Have just come back fro® a three day visit with Bob
Shafer and Jack Ellery and work on the video concerning
the social and educational derivatives of print,
I enclose a rough draft. Should any ideas or film
clips occur to you in connection with any of the shots,
please scribble a note.
Ellery and Dreyfus think they can do it for about'
£400 out of our budget, and are charging this only because
they want to do it on a Saturday in order to do a better
job. This will mean paying a few fees.
A bit of luck while staying with Bob Shafer when
Ken McCrorle and his wife turned up, so they worked over
the script with me. He’s film man at Michigan State and
he approved the whole thing in principle just as it stands.
The form is not sequential, but montage, in order to re¬
veal repetition of basic form in many simultaneous situa¬
tions,
Ellery and Dreyfus consider that still shots will be
quite useful, as well as graphics. But we shall strive for
a good deal of animation both in the cartoon and film form,
:usanne Shafer is doing her Doctorate at Ann Arbor on
the effects of the American educational program in Germany,
I have urged her to get in touch with you concerning radio
